title: When was the first release of HBO's 'Leaving Neverland'? - Quora
tags: Leaving Neverland: Michael Jackson and Me (2019 film)

response.answer_text: It is not HBO’s “Finding Neverland.” It is a film, just like any other film. It is a documentary film, It had its very first premiere at this year’s Sundance Film Festival.At its premiere showings at the Sundance Film Festival, the Jackson Estate staged large protests outside of the theater (of course), but the police outnumbered the protestors. The screenings went on as planned, and the film received standing ovations. (Standing ovations are not typical for a film festival; it has happened, but it is somewhat rare).After that, several distributors put in bids and negotiated with the two producers for the rights to distribute the film. HBO won a bid to “premiere” the film nationwide in the US, before anyone else would be able to distribute it. They had the rights to “premiere” it on both HBO and HBO-Go, and Channel 4 Media — but only for a brief time. There were other distributors who then won the rights for additional platforms, after HBO’s short-term deal ends — and those include the usual streaming platforms, and Blu-Ray, and DVD.Last week, the producers also sold the international rights in 130 other nations. That was announced on March 4.“Major TV buyers include free-to-air giants ProSiebenSat.1 in Germany, M6 in France, and Network 10 in Australia. Swedish pubcaster SVT is another buyer, as is Channel One in Russia, where Amedia has it for pay-TV. Fox has acquired it for Asia and Front Row for the Middle East. HBO has just aired the first installment of the film in the U.S. and has taken it for its networks in Latin America and Central Europe. In Spain, pay-TV heavyweight Movistar+ has acquired rights. Channel 4 will begin airing “Leaving Neverland” on Wednesday in Britain.”The real ownership belongs to the three producers: Marc Forster, Nellie Bellflower, and Richard N. Gladstein. Marc Forster was also the director of the film.Hope this helps.—-Michael Jackson Documentary Leaving Neverland Stuns at SundanceSundance Will Not Pull Michael Jackson Child Abuse Doc ‘Leaving Neverland’ Amid Fan Protestshttps://www.esquire.com/entertainment/movies/a26036776/michael-jackson-leaving-neverland-documentary-sundance-protests/Sundance: Premiere of Michael Jackson Doc 'Leaving Neverland' Attracts Small Group of Protestors‘Leaving Neverland’ Sells Around the World‘Leaving Neverland’ Goes Global After Kew Media Sells Controversial Michael Jackson Doc Into 130 Territories
